alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 4:45AM PST until January 03 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE THROUGH MONDAY... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore tonight through Monday. King Tides occur when tidal forces maximize as the moon, earth, and sun come into alignment while the moon is in perigee (nearest to the earth) and the earth is at perihelion (nearest to the sun). These tides will peak during the mid to late morning and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas each year. In addition, the lowest low tides of the season will follow hours later in the afternoons that may lead to trouble for mariners navigating shallow waterways. The King Tides tidal readings are expected to peak Sunday. ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding expected at prone low lying coastal locations across the San Francisco Bay shoreline during peak high tide through Monday. * WHERE...Low lying portions of the San Francisco Bayshore. Localized impacts are also possible in low lying areas along the Pacific shore as well, such as near Elkhorn Slough. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Monday. The highest high tides are expected to occur during mid to late morning while the lowest low tides will occur during mid afternoon to early evening. Please refer to local tidal data forecasts available for several coastal and bayshore locations at www.tidesandcurrents.noaa.gov. * IMPACTS...Flooding of areas previously impacted by King Tide events is expected, including low lying lots, parks, and roads throughout the San Francisco Bay Shoreline with the highest high tides. Difficulty navigating shallow bay waters during the lowest low tides. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tidal levels will also rise along the Pacific coast but impacts will be more localized to areas such as Elkhorn Slough near Moss Landing. Tide poolers and beachgoers should be familiar with the times and heights of local tidal levels to avoid hazards that may arise from rapidly shifting water levels.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
